extends java.lang.Object
    Model for MavenCalculator project.

      • calculatorMemory

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> calculatorMemory
        Contains all the entered data. Each element in this list resembles each step of calculating.

    • Method Detail

      • count

        private void count()
        Counts position in the calculatorMemory array.

      • isANumber

        private boolean isANumber(java.lang.String s)
        Checks if s is a number.
        Parameters:
        s - the String to be checked. It counts '.' as part of a number, so it can process double type.
        Returns:
        true if s is a number

      • saveMemory

        private void saveMemory()
        Saves the calculatorSequence into calculatorMemory. Adds on top of existing calculatorMemory elements and seperates them with ', '.

      • getMessage

        private java.lang.String getMessage()
        Gets the output calculator message for the user from calculatorMemory and calculatorSequence ArrayLists.
        Returns:
        calculation line values and operations

      • checkCalculatorSequence

        private boolean checkCalculatorSequence(int i)
        Checks if calculatorSequence is big enough, avoiding the Array out of boundaries exception.
        Parameters:
        i - position to be checked
        Returns:
        true if calculatorSequence.size() is big enough

      • Add

        private double Add(double a,
                   double b)
        Adds two doubles.
        Parameters:
        a - a double number
        b - a double number
        Returns:
        product of a+b

        public java.lang.String addDot()
        Adds a dot to a number if no dot is already added and then returns the getMessage()

      • NumbersCalculation

        public java.lang.String NumbersCalculation(int i)
        Calculates in which position of calculatorSequence should the entered 'i' parameter be put in and then returns getMessage().
        Parameters:
        i - an int number that should be inserted into calculatorSequence
        Returns:
        getMessage()

      • setCalculatorSequence

        private void setCalculatorSequence(int i,
                                   java.lang.String s)
        Sets calculatorSequence value to String 's' or adds an element if none exists in 'i' index position.
        Parameters:
        i - index position
        s - a String that is to be put into calculatorSequence array

      • addOperator

        public java.lang.String addOperator(java.lang.String s)
        Adds an operator contained in parameter s to calculatorSequence array(if its the proper position), and then returns getMessage().
        Parameters:
        s - a String containing an operator for calculations
        Returns:
        getMessage()

      • runAnOperation

        private java.lang.String runAnOperation(int i,
                                        int j)
        Runs an operation, depending on what operator is in calculatorSequence and then returns getDouble(z) which contains properly formatted data into String.
        Parameters:
        i - position in calculatorSequence for double number 'a'
        j - position in calculatorSequence for double number 'b'
        Returns:
        returns (String) getDouble(z)

      • clearAll

        public java.lang.String clearAll()
        Clears all.
        Returns:
        null

      • clear

        public java.lang.String clear()
        Clears last entered data, unless it was already saved (saveMemory()) and returns getMessage().
        Returns:
        getMessage()
